        ef - the function defining the roots to be found

      • integrate

        public double integrate(double t0,
               double[] x0,
               double t1)
                 throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Description copied from interface: Solver
        Integrate the ODE.
        Specified by:
        integrate in interface Solver
        Parameters:
        t0 - the start time of the integration
        x0 - the initial state
        t1 - the stop time of the integration
        Returns:
        the time where the integration has stopped
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the solver only implements integration with TimepointProviders

      • prepareStep

        public void prepareStep(double t0,
               double[] x0,
               double t1)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: AdaptiveStepSolver
        Prepare a call to AdaptiveStepSolver.integrateStep().
        Specified by:
        prepareStep in interface AdaptiveStepSolver
        Parameters:
        t0 - defines the current timepoint for the integration
        x0 - defines the current state for the integration
        t1 - defines the end timepoint for the integration
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if AdaptiveStepSolver.initialize(ch.ethz.bhepp.ode.Ode) has not been called before

      • prepareStep

        public void prepareStep(double t0,
               double[] x0,
               double t1,
               double dt0)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: AdaptiveStepSolver
        Prepare a call to AdaptiveStepSolver.integrateStep().
        Specified by:
        prepareStep in interface AdaptiveStepSolver
        Parameters:
        t0 - defines the current timepoint for the integration
        x0 - defines the current state for the integration
        t1 - defines the end timepoint for the integration
        dt0 - defines the initial step size
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if AdaptiveStepSolver.initialize(ch.ethz.bhepp.ode.Ode) has not been called before

      • integrateStep

        public double integrateStep()
        Description copied from interface: AdaptiveStepSolver
        Integrate the ODE with a single step. AdaptiveStepSolver.prepareStep(double, double[], double) has to be called before calling this method.
        Specified by:
        integrateStep in interface AdaptiveStepSolver
        Returns:
        the new timepoint after the integration step

      • integrateStep

        public double integrateStep(double[] xOut)
        Description copied from interface: AdaptiveStepSolver
        Integrate the ODE with a single step. AdaptiveStepSolver.prepareStep(double, double[], double) has to be called before calling this method.
        Specified by:
        integrateStep in interface AdaptiveStepSolver
        Parameters:
        xOut - array to store the new state after the integration step
        Returns:
        the new timepoint after the integration step

      • computeInterpolatedSolution

        public void computeInterpolatedSolution(double t,
                               double[] xOut)
                                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: AdaptiveStepSolver
        Compute the interpolated solution at a timepoint within the last integration step. AdaptiveStepSolver.integrateStep() has to be called before calling this method.
        Specified by:
        computeInterpolatedSolution in interface AdaptiveStepSolver
        Parameters:
        t - the timepoint at which the interpolated solution should be computed
        xOut - array to store the new state after the integration step
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if AdaptiveStepSolver.integrateStep() has not been called before, the last integration step failed or the solution could not be interpolated.

      • integrate

        public double integrate()
                 throws Solver.IntegrationException,
                        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: Solver
        Integrate the ODE. The user is responsible to call Solver.prepare(ch.ethz.bhepp.ode.TimepointProvider, double[]) before calling this function.
        Specified by:
        integrate in interface Solver
        Returns:
        the time where the integration has stopped
        Throws:
        Solver.IntegrationException - if there was a problem during the integration
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if Solver.initialize(ch.ethz.bhepp.ode.Ode, ch.ethz.bhepp.ode.EventFunction, ch.ethz.bhepp.ode.StateObserver, ch.ethz.bhepp.ode.EventObserver) has not been called before

        Description copied from interface: Solver

        Specified by:

        x - the initial state
        Returns:

        Throws:

      • getCurrentStepSize

        public double getCurrentStepSize()
                          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                 java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Description copied from interface: AdaptiveStepSolver
        Get the current step size of the solver (used for the next step). AdaptiveStepSolver.integrateStep() has to be called before calling this method.
        Specified by:
        getCurrentStepSize in interface AdaptiveStepSolver
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if AdaptiveStepSolver.initialize(ch.ethz.bhepp.ode.Ode) has not been called before
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the solver doesn't support retrieving the current step size

      • setCurrentStepSize

        Specified by:

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if AdaptiveStepSolver.initialize(ch.ethz.bhepp.ode.Ode) has not been called before
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the solver doesn't support modifying the step size
